answers.answer: i have experienced neuropathy for the past few weeks and am wondering if it's a potential symptom... or if that is something that only occurs in people who have lived with hiv for a while

As far as I'm aware neuropathy is not a symptom of HIV. I have been HIV+ for approximately 13 years. The only time I experienced neuropathy was three years ago when I underwent chemotherapy. It caused me to get neuropathy very bad. Though I've never had shingles before, but from talking with people who have had shingles it sounds very similar (constant burning feeling like your skin is literally on fire). If you are experiencing symptoms like that I would definitely recommend seeing a doctor and get checked out.
